DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure for the flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exposure as Collected Domain Infusion Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected._Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Concepts.definition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Property.preferredDefinition: A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2021-6-11 ak Released per governance approval.; 8-27-18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task/tt.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC CDASH Unit of Measure for Flow Rate Terminology Unit of Measure
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Unit of Measure for Flow Rate terminology._A named quantity in terms of which other quantities are measured or specified, used as a standard measurement of like kinds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one minute. Microgram per minute is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to one minute.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to one minute. Microgram per minute is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to one minute.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of volumetric flow rate defined as the rate at which one milliliter of matter crosses a given surface during the period of time equal to one minute.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a mole of substance crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to 24 hours.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one thousandth of a mole of substance crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to 24 hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a mole of substance crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to 24 hours.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a mole of substance crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to 24 hours.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Microgram per 24 hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

Concepts.definition: A unit of mass flow rate equivalent to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of matter crosses a given surface or is delivered to a given object or space over a period of time equal to twenty four hours. Microgram per 24 hours is also a dose administration rate unit equal to the rate at which one millionth of a gram of a product is administered per unit of time equal to twenty four hours.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ReferenceDocuments.description: A terminology subset of the CDISC Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) Unit codelist created for Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Unit of Measure for Flow Rate terminology.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form  Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the unit for the infusion rate (e.g., mL/min).

ReferenceDocuments.name: SUPPEC.QVAL
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECFLRTU" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
